# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the solution in Julia. Note that we need to make use of the `Dates` package for handling dates and times in Julia, so make sure you have it installed.

The function `add_yearmonth` should look like this:
```julia
using Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [DateTime(x).year * 100 + DateTime(x).month for x in df[:dt]]
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it, which is an integer representing the year-month combination from the original date.

You can call this function like so:

```julia
using DataFrames
add_yearmonth(DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2021, 4, 5), DateTime(2022, 6, 8)]))
```
This will return a new DataFrame with the additional `ym` column:

| dt                | ym    |
| ----------------- | ----- |
| 2021-04-05T00:00:00 | 202104 |
| 2022-06-08T00:00:00 | 202206 |
